sentence.Network_en: You burrow and rankle in his heart!
sentence.Network_cn: 你挖掘并折磨他的心灵!

sentence.Network_en: The dimensions of the Brys'ballroom must rankle her.
sentence.Network_cn: 百利太太那间大舞厅一定惹得她妒火中烧.

You burrow and rankle in his heart !, 你挖掘并折磨他的心灵!

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French rancler, from rancle, draoncle 'festering sore', from an alteration of medieval Latin dracunculus, diminutive of draco 'serpent'

entry.def: If an event or situation rankles, it makes you feel angry or bitter afterwards, because you think it was unfair or wrong.

example.ex: They paid him only £10 for it and it really rankled...
example.tran: 他们仅为此付给他10英镑，这真让他感到愤怒。

example.ex: Britain's refusal to sell Portugal arms in 1937 still rankled with him...
example.tran: 1937年英国拒绝向葡萄牙销售武器的事情仍然令他愤慨。

means.word_mean: 1. gnaw into; make resentful or angry;

auth_sentence.content: Only in retrospect does it begin to rankle.
auth_sentence.res_content: Only in retrospect does it begin to rankle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Only in retrospect does it begin to rankle.

auth_sentence.content: I concede that I rankle a bit inside when my "environmentalist" friends even think of having a third kid here in the US.
auth_sentence.res_content: I concede that I rankle a bit inside when my "environmentalist" friends even think of having a third kid here in the US.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I concede that I rankle a bit inside when my "environmentalist" friends even think of having a third kid here in the US.

sentences.en: The insult rankled in his mind.
sentences.cn: 这种侮辱使他心里难受。

sentences.en: The noise that trunks and ambulances made in the street rankles me every day.
sentences.cn: 每天大街上卡车和救护车的噪音令我恼怒不已。
